intro: Scaphosepalum bicolor, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble small bells, which are typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Scaphosepalum bicolor is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
